website_summaries.verdict: If you like Kevo's capabilities and don't mind the higher cost, this is a good choice – but keep in mind there are still some issues with its functionality.
pros: Has similar features to the 1st Gen Kevo, including Bluetooth and multiple device compatibility
but the design is more streamlined, connection is more reliable, and eKeys are available at no extra charge
cons: Software updates are slow to download
Reports of it locking on its own, which also results in battery drain
More than double the cost of the Kevo 1st Gen

customer_reviews.title: The front part of the lock never worked once. ...
customer_reviews.text: The front part of the lock never worked once. Their is a tiny little wire that goes from the front of the lock to the back and it had little pins you have to connect in a very awkward manner. When I was removing the entire lock to return it a screw head popped off and it was incredibly difficult to get it off the door. This technology is not mature enough.
customer_reviews.author: Early Adopter

customer_reviews.title: very unreliable product.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through great frustration replacing three systems at my remote airbnb units. The system would completely die without warning. getting guests trapped outside and having a friend drive and get them physical keys.. getting costumer service on the phone is hours at a time. troubleshooting was complicated even for me being technologically advanced. the App allows guests not only to enter but to accidentally uninstall the lock.No simple short videos to fix. replecment with credit card deposit (holds) were charged regardless of return with proof mailed. I will be looking for something more reliable to my airbnb homes. I just can't take the failure rates anymore.
customer_reviews.author: L&A

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I lowered my rating to 1 star. It has become buggy and eats batteries even faster than it used to. I thought about giving this 3 stars, but I wanted to make sure potential buyers get a good warning. First, this thing eats batteries. To change the batteries, there are 3 screws to get the cover off. Why 3? They could have easily designed this with only 1 screw. It also does not like rechargable batteries. Expensive and wasteful! Second, it can be flaky with opening and closing. Unfortunately, I kept this thing long enough that the return window was missed. Being at this price point makes it hard to move on to a different product...
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Tap to lock is annoying
customer_reviews.text: These do the job and are easy to install. However the Tap-to-lock function is quite annoying. Every time you brush it, it goes off, which means that it will sometimes lock while the door is being closed or while sitting open. Also, these extra open and close actions burn the battery much more quickly. It's also impossible to disable the tap-to-close part of the app on your device without force stop (android) or disabling bluetooth (android/ios). It would be nice if the app could add a confirmation click, at least, or a complete disable of the tap-to-lock feature.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good lock for smart lock beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lock! I am a single 25 year old female and this was easy to install using the video instructions; it took me about 30-45 minutes to get it completely functional and connected to the app. It is easy to lock yourself out the first few times because whenever your phone is in range and you touch the deadbolt it will lock/unlock. I really like how you can unlock/lock by pushing the button on your phone. The only downside is that guests have to have the KEVO app and you can only send a “key” to their email. Otherwise, I really like this for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy, it is a piece of junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible over priced piece of junk! I bought 2 for my new house. One installed fine and the second one the locksmith even struggled with installing. The second one eats up batteries like it's the Energizer bunny on it's last leg and now its started circling the yellow/amber color and it will not stop. It will not reset or do anything so I had to take the battery pack out because if I don't I'll have a circle constantly going around my deadbolt. Now its just like a lock I could have bought for 10 dollars. Save your money it is a total piece of junk!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser2569

customer_reviews.title: Listen to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I love Kwikset locks but after only working for 5 days the wireless and smart portion of the lock stopped working. I tried to reset it, change the batteries and it still wouldn't work. I am just glad that I was able to return it before it was too late. The app was nice and easy to manage users but I would have preferred better integration and more simple use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve never purchased
customer_reviews.text: Had the lock since July, worked good for two weeks. Then my wife started having issues, then I started having issues, then I did the update and now the app never sees the lock so you can’t unlock the door from the car on a rainy day. Then once you get to the door you have to touch it 3 or 4 times or reach into your pocket and pull your phone out. I’ve tried re calibrating, uninstalling then reinstalling, troubleshooting. All of it and it all leads nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Krebs

customer_reviews.title: SHORT battery life! Unreliable operation!!
customer_reviews.text: Batteries last 1-4 weeks with only part time use. Advertised one year life at 10 cycles per day is totally misleading. I agree with spotty reliability as mentioned by other reviewers. Very long wait times for customer service - go figure. I’ve done everything I’m supposed to do to minimize battery consumption to no avail. Update: now will unlock remotely but won’t lock remotely. Touch operation never has been reliable. A year of frustration is coming to a close - replacing with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wallace E. Graham Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Had only one hiccup after install. Lock didn't finger touch open all the time. Kept having to take my phone out of the leg pocket of my cargo shorts. After checking the FAQ on support it turns out that when I paired the lock with my phone I had it lock level and closer than my cargo pocket and that's where my lock expected it to be. Anywhere else I guess it gets a bit testy. I had to re-pair the phone with the phone in my pocket. Guess its kinda particular.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Williams

customer_reviews.title: installed worthless junk! Buy the Yale
customer_reviews.text: Wow after getting this installed and set up I find it "jams" all the time making the bluetooth/ WiFi portion of this lock worthless. I hope Kwikset steps up on this product because I am a techie and this is poor product software design. It definitely needs a firmware update. For now I have installed junk and should have went with the #1 rated Yale bluetooth lock.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: This is my third Kevo Kwikset Door Lock
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kevo Kwikset Door Lock because the first one has worked so well for several years. The only reason that features is only 4 stars is it is slightly less convenient to replace the batteries on the latest model. My old locks on each door were the some dimensions as Kwikset so every step of installations was very easy. There is a device that connects two of the locks to the wifi network in my new house so that I can operate the locks from any where I have phone service.
customer_reviews.author: GGZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock in a basic looking package.
customer_reviews.text: Lock works pretty well, not 100% of the time but neither does anything relying on wireless connections. The handing process didn’t retract the lock completely which made it seem like it wasn’t working properly. I followed the instructions and removed and reinstalled everything with the same outcome. I ignored this and continued with the phone setup and the lock would retract completely every time. I’ve only had the lock for one week with 1 failed attempt to open due to not connecting with the phone, I pulled my phone out of my pocket and it worked with no real intervention needed. All in all I would buy this lock again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Mayne

customer_reviews.title: locks on its own
customer_reviews.text: I love having keyless entry. I just click the app from my car and I can hear it locking or unlocking. I have noticed that sometimes when I manually unlock it from the inside as I am stepping out the lock mechanism starts on its own. This has almost left me locked out since I was just stepping outside for a second. Now I have to hide a key outside just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great but better with the bridge
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a smart lock that works with my Ring Pro. Now when I have a friend come over when I am not home I can answer the door with ring app and click the Kevo icon which opens the Kēvo app to allow me to unlock the door remotely. You need to spend another $100 for the bridge to do this. But once you make the investment you forget about how much you spent on the door lock and bridge and just enjoy the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Urban

customer_reviews.title: Non-responsive to Kevo app, key fobs aren't reliable
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our new home a few months ago. From the beginning, we knew that we did not want to have to pull out our cell phones/turn bluetooth on, etc. to use the lock. We also purchased the additional key fobs to be able to use the lock more easily. From the beginning, we had an issue connecting the lock to our phone apps, and had to rely on the fobs (separate review on those). Our lock now requires a software update, and will not connect to our phone app at all. The locking mechanism is clunky, and often will not close completely. We are looking for other keyless options after only using this lock for 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: SpartyChicago

customer_reviews.title: 50/50. It's a gamble.
customer_reviews.text: It's great when it works. Sadly however, it only works less than half the time. When I actually have to pull out my phone to lock/unlock the door, this item becomes junk and pointless. I order 2 and I returned 2. Great idea, just poor performance. Fyi.....you cannot update the lock without an iphone, iPad, ipod or isomething.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Do not BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful! When accessing remotely, and trying to lock, app indicates that the lockis "locking", "confirming", and "locked", when in reality it isn't! This happens when the battery is low, but there is no indication in the app that this is the case. How can you indicate that the lock is confirmed as locked, when indeed it isn't, and not inform the user that it can't lock because of a low battery?! Simply UNACCEPTABLE! Also, the lock has web access, and cannot indicate the live condition of the light indicator sequence- the should be a way to display the current light status on a virtual image in the app duplicating the actual unit, remotely- very lacking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this lock
customer_reviews.text: It’s wonderful and super easy to install, zero issues with that. The one that I got worked great except the touch feature which didn’t work at all. I called kwikset and they had me do some troubleshooting and then replaced it for me. The new one arrived and I had it installed and working with the touch feature in less than 10 minutes, except for the over-the-air update it needed to do, which took about 15-20 mins I’d guess.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product, horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Doesn’t work about 80% of the time. Must open app and wait for connection even though Bluetooth is on and connected. Battery needs replacement every month which entails taking the lock apart and repairing all devices. Ridiculous. Worst product ever, wish I had never installed or purchased.
customer_reviews.author: BookGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well but can be flakey
customer_reviews.text: The Kevo approach seems to be more secure than most but the software is flakey. A lot of times I need to reopen the app on my phone. It works about 50% of the time even with the key fob I bought for running. The software is bad and needs a lot of work. it all does work, but it doesn't work as well as you would want it to work. If you want a smart lock it's the best according to various review sites and it does work well but not as well as I wish it would. I also wish it worked with my Apple Watch when using the Kevo Plus add on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not Convenient
customer_reviews.text: The response time on this lock is highly disappointing. According to Kwikset I should have the app open on an iPhone to get it to open quicker. It still takes 2-3 tries. If I knew i should have my phone out to open it, I would just have kept using my keys on a normal deadbolt.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre.
customer_reviews.text: Very mediocre product. Works, but not sensitive enough to detect all touches. Also, you have to keep the app open in the background on your phone, which isn't super convenient. Also, if you lock it, you have to wait for about 10 seconds for it to be able to unlock it again. Looks slick, without being too obtrusive, but not as polished as I would expect a "key replacement" to be.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Convenient mostly
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this product but there is often a lag when opening with my phone. We also have a key fob and that works better. I suggest getting a fob rather than relying on your phone for the touch open. I love the smart key feature so all of our locks match. Originally we bought a touchpad from Kwikset but returned two of them because they didn’t really work. This definitely works better and I like not having to pull keys out. I just wish it was a bit more responsive.
customer_reviews.author: JL27

customer_reviews.title: App doesn’t connect most of the time + deadbolt issues
customer_reviews.text: App rarely connected to the lock, so pretty much useless. Installing is okay, but if your door isn’t perfectly aligned then you’ll get a jammed lock notice even though the deadbolt locked the door successfully. Seems like a great idea but the execution is poor. Fix the app and make the deadbolt sensors more tolerant to real world conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad
customer_reviews.text: Does not work most of the time. Very unreliable. When it works it's slow to detect phone or key. These days it seems not to work at all either with kevo's fobs or with the phone. It also always ate batteries. A real waste of money. After several months of hoping it would work I'm removing the batteries and using it as a normal lock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: hands free door lock.
customer_reviews.text: It is convenient in a way.... but in the long run. I have a difficult time getting the bluetooth to wake up. I end up using the phone to open the door mostly. Tapping it is pretty slow, the video looks so much easier and reliable then it actually is. Maybe we are doing something wrong. The update, takes a long time. We had to call to get help twice so far. Customer Service was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: LO

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the worst investment I have ever made. I bought 5 of them. They seldom work and most of the time they just give you a one color light show and then quit. The app has to be running and then they still seldom work. On the rare occasion they do work they take more time to unlock than it takes to get your keys out of your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as smart as it thinks!
customer_reviews.text: Ok construction, bought this specifically to connect to my smart home with Alexa as the hub. It will not connect. I feel like I flushed the money down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: When it works its great but don't bet your kids on it.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's great. However, randomly it just stops communicating and the only way to get it back is to reset the whole lock and redo the setup. Very frustrating. For the last two months we just quit using the front door because the lock didn't work. Then all of a sudden we get notifications on our phones that the batteries in the lock were low. How could it communicate that the batteries were low when it wouldn't recognize our phones to lock or unlock the door. They seem to have a ways to go with their technology or we just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: PTCDAA

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Beware this only works with a very limited number of phones, which totally nullified the purpose of the key less features... I bought it to be able to give access to guests, but I couldn't even get my phone to work with it. Badly designed software and very bad implementation of Bluetooth protocols. The phone sees Kevo, but Kevo cannot see the phone, so I don't think the phone is the culprit. I returned the product after wasting two hours trying to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deadbolt lock
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works very well. Battery life depends on how much you use it. When we first got it the batteries that came with it died within 2 days, but the new batteries have been in for about 3 weeks now and no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Performance greatly improved with the recent firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this lock for about half a year, and until recently it never worked too well. I’d touch the lock and the blue light would spin, but it only recognized the presence of my iPhone about 20% of the time, so I’d have to pull out my old-timey key. That pretty much negated my whole reason for having a smart lock. But then about 2 weeks ago (Sept 2019) there was a firmware update. Immediately, and ever since then, the lock hasn’t failed once! I am much, much happier with the product now.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: Very poor Bluetooth connection. I’ve had to calibrate this lock over and over. Biggest reason why I got this lock was for my wife with her hands full with backpacks and kids, she wouldn’t have to dig for her keys. Works maybe 1 in 10tries. By the 5 try, I’ve already had to open my phone app, and manually checking if it’s connecting... nope. At the end of it all, I’m stuck with a $200 deadbolt. Wish the company that I purchased this from could make this better, as of this point I don’t want a electronic lock anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo O.

customer_reviews.title: Not a great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a single occupant and with very little usage average 2 times a day. The batteries need to be changed every month rather less than a month. I have No Interest in Alexa integration and from above mentioned issue i believe it will make it worst in case of integration.
customer_reviews.author: Amin R.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive clunk.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well for a month. But it kept losing contact to the bluetooth even with phone right next to it. The features are great in theory, but the execution is extremely poor. There’s many other options for 200 dollars that are much better. I recommend to stay away from the Kēvo Products. I can’t see this line being supported in 2 years, it’s a failure.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Almost but not quite
customer_reviews.text: Only works intermittently, except the auto-lock feature which always works. I can't get the firmware update to work despite several attempts on various phones
customer_reviews.author: TL-AC

customer_reviews.title: App does not scan Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: If I can give this product a negative star I would love to. The app Bluetooth does not automatically scan for the Kēvo. You have to pull your phone out Tao on the app and wait for it scan the device for 2 minutes then tap on the unlock to open the door. That totally defeats the purpose of convenience. Kevo is luck I am a busy person and don’t have time to return this worthless product back.
customer_reviews.author: Khanh Tran

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Lock never worked properly. Tried to contact tech support to no avail. We had to use regular key to unlock and lock the door, which defeated the whole purpose. Then when using the key it was so hard to unlock I really thought the key was going to break a couple of times. Finally found a great replacement from August locks during prime days that I love! I just hate we are out of money for this Kevo crap. Would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter white

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable in opening daily
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth doesn’t always work and I have to tap a couple times or open app manually. Maybe this is why I have to change battery so often it seems compared to other door (Schlage) Wish it was easier to use daily. I almost returned it but decided too much effort to install another one.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Randomly locks and unlocks on my RV
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a class A RV for main door. Steel frame and fiberglass surface with aluminum trim. Opens and closes, but also randomly unlocks and locks A LOT. About half the time I unlock the door and begin opening it there is something that causes it to almost immediately start to close again.. I come back sometimes and it is already unlocked. Sometimes I go out and return a minute later and it locked itself
customer_reviews.author: Greg Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, doest work as advertised!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! I have had nothing but problems with this and I have had to call customer service a number of times with no fix. I have to get my phone out and let the app connect every time and it eats batteries alive! If you are set on buying one you can get one on ebay brand new for half off because everyone wants to get rid of them when they get the replacement lock under the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the Kevo locks for my house and love it. Easy to install but do follow the instructions. If you don't hang the deadbolt properly as per the instructions it won't work properly. Use is very easy and make getting into my house very easy when I have a handful of items. The only reason why I didn't give this item. 5 stars is that I do find using the app to lock and unlock the doors from inside the house a little time consuming. Other than that the product works great. Also, Apple users who are having difficulty using Kevo with the newest iOS I have read that the newest Kevo app rectifies these issues.
customer_reviews.author: @PaulJTra

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well except as a basic key lock
customer_reviews.text: At least for android phones this doesn't work well. There is a painful calibration process required involving cycling the lock 20+ times while standing outside. And even after doing it several times, after a few days the lock will just not connect unless I download the app again and reset the lock entirely which means everyone needs to be sent a new key.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Kwikset Kevo lock we've installed at our house and neither has been easy to install (technically speaking - the pairing process is always hard). However, this time we bought refurbished and not only did they provide the wrong key, but the light is also inoperable and it won't pair or reset so I CAN pair it to my phone. What a hassle. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Continues to fail to lock or unlock.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock so I could eliminate the need to use a mechanical key. However, it fails to operate so often that I still need to use a mechanical key at least 50% of the time. I thought it was perhaps the phone APP, so I purchased the key fobs designed to work with it. Alas, it's the same, it refuses to operate 50% of the time. Lately, I get a low battery report in my email even after changing the batteries less than week ago. I'm very disappointed with the product and wish I had purchased something else. I would not recommend others to purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry A Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it works but that isn't often enough to justify the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good lock when it works but that isn't often enough to justify the price including fobs and a kevo plus (trying to get it to work). Recalibrate the application and it works for a week then it will stop, tap the lock and you have a 20% chance it will work. The wind blows and then it will lock when the door is open so it can't be shut. I now have a $200 lock that I have to use a key on since I had to take the batteries out to save my sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Bruning

customer_reviews.title: These locks are awesome. They are really easy to setup and install
customer_reviews.text: These locks are awesome. They are really easy to setup and install. We're using this for multiple studio space's we rent from our business and its super easy to give someone a digital key. One drawback, is that some clients don't have compatible phones so it essential becomes just another deadbolt, hopefully Kevo can start increasing interoperability and compatibility with other phones and tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The entire setup for Kevo 2nd generation lock is worthless and outright frustrating. It doesn’t work vast majority of time. You touch the lock, wait for 10-15 seconds and nothing happens. Then you end up pulling out the key to open manually. Such an embarrassment for the company. I bought it thinking my kids can open the door while I’m coming out of the car with them. It doesn’t work whether I’m by the door or within 20 feet by my car on the driveway. I would like to return to the company if had that option.
customer_reviews.author: MARIUSZ MAZUR

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and just outright frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst electronic lock I have ever used! It constantly loses connection, goes through batteries every month and is totally unreliable. SAVE YOUR MONEY and look elsewhere, the frustration is not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: PicassoPC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This lock is absolute garbage and the customer support isn't much better. We purchased this along with two of their fobs so that we wouldn't need to have to deal with keys or phones when entering our home. The kwikset kevo lock is SO slow to respond. It often takes multiple tries for it to recognize the fob is near even though the fob is always in the same location and we purposely stand in the same position to unlock the door. GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great use between touch and bluetooth. What a great functioning deadbolt. I was a little frustrated with the installation. It wasn't the online instruction I think it was more my impatience. After a month or so. Works well so far. Hot or cold. Even through some globes. Phone must be within 2ft. So go slow on install and enjoy this wonderful advanced lock.
customer_reviews.author: bob whiteside

customer_reviews.title: Same security - easy key and more control.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install.. love the ability to have ekey. Would like to have: - Wi-Fi version of this model. - log entry using the standard key - control sound
customer_reviews.author: Jmunoz

customer_reviews.title: Good functioning modern lock
customer_reviews.text: This is relatively easy to install. It looks good. It works well though I will say the keyless opening sometimes takes longer than I would like. At those times it would probably be faster to open it with the key. Their customer support is outstanding and it is well warrantied. I am quite happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Emerging tech not 100% reliable
customer_reviews.text: Have this as a gift to my son in law who is a major computer expert. He says it is unreliable. Sometimes it doesn’t unlock even when standing next to it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're coming from the wire cutter turn around. This is crap all around.
customer_reviews.text: Customer service 0 Technology 0 Install 0 I have been on with support for an hour trying to get my phone to pair to no avail. They said they will need to ship me a new internal unit in 14 days!? I was on hold for 30 mins before anyone ever answered in the middle of the day. They also said their batteries might be dead and to go buy new ones. I buy almost everything off the wire cutter reviews but this is wrong. *edit, spoke with a surpervisor. She said broken units happen all the time and the warranty only covers ground shipping and to go pound sand. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Charging

customer_reviews.title: Drains battery
customer_reviews.text: I typically don't write reviews but i feel like i should write one for this product as a public service announcement. I bought two of the Kevo 2nd generation locks after glorious reviews and recommendations it got in several sites. This is the worst piece of electronics I've ever bought. It drains battery like anything. There's absolutely no resistance or alignment issue between deadbolt and strike. I changed all batteries yesterday and it's all drained today. Between yesterday and today the lock was literally used only like 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Good lock, but Cell Phone Operation has serious problem with more than one lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these locks, and installation went well in my boathouse. No problem getting it to work reliably with my Samsung phone. I was happy, so I bought one for my garage and my house. Again, install went well. But cellphone app would not reliably operate more than one lock. After calls to support and no joy, more or less gave up on cellphone access and bought electronic key fob. With the fob the three locks work reliably. But if you have more than one of these locks don't expect to operate the lock with your cell phone. Don't know if this is Android specific or if it hangs together with an IPhone.
customer_reviews.author: John Langeland

customer_reviews.title: Good Lock - Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: The lock works fairly well, though often it takes time to recognize the device to lock or unlock. Calls to Kevo just ring, making support lacking. This lock really needs to work with Google, not just Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Traveler

customer_reviews.title: No, no, and no again
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our new home as we've been purchasing smart items for lighting, security, etc. We bought this lock thinking how great it would be to lock from our phone and know we were safer for the time. Unfortunately, we have had it for less than two weeks installed and it just stopped working. Of course, naturally it's a Saturday night so we cannot even call the support for assistance. My phone says that I am connecting but it is just searching and now says I need to activate an ekey even though my phone is the admin. I wouldn't advise anyone to waste their money on this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The technology is definitely cool and I really wanted to like it. However, it's been incredibly unreliable. It searches and searches and can take up to 15 minutes to connect. On several occasions it has simply "rebooted" indefinitely and I had to take it apart to reset it. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this lock is great. It makes it easy to send a temporary key to guests that you can delete when they leave. The lock itself is always needing the battery changed which can be a pain. Also you almost always have to have your phone out and app open to unlock the door (the company says you do not). Could definitely use some improvements for gen. 3. To be honest not worth the $$$ or the extra $100 to make it work on WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Cage

customer_reviews.title: Works when it wants to.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor execution. I spent weeks adjusting, resetting, troubleshooting, double checking, replacing batteries, calibrating, re-resetting and finally gave up. This thing just doesn't work consistently enough for the primary entrance of a house. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Hub is important to have.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install because I had a current kwikset lock - non-bluetooth. I can't speak for those with other brands already installed. You will need the hub to get the most out if this product though.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works great with android phones
customer_reviews.text: Works great with android phones, but makes you open the app Every Time for iPhones, and if you ever need to contact them, the service is absolutely horrible! You literally need to call six or seven times just to be able to leave a callback number and stay on hold for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawed from the box
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work, but the internal connection piece was either sideways or completely upside down. Therefore you couldn't use the bluetooth function (kept jamming). The key operation was EXTREMELY stiff. I assumed this was just a manufacturer error that happens periodically, so I ordered a second one SAME problem. Won't be trying for a third!
customer_reviews.author: BJL

customer_reviews.title: Advanced Designed to Annoy!
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything. I tried calibrating, resetting, resetting the calibration, prayer. I come home, tap the deadbolt and all I get is a rotating blue light for what seems forever and nothing. The only cool feature is the 40 minutes of hold music you get when calling tech support. Save your money and get yourself something between July and September. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Besnik D.

customer_reviews.title: Awful product that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first review I’ve written for something purchased on amazon but I felt the need to share because of how truly awful the product is. This lock DOES NOT WORK. I purchased the second generation because I thought the kinks from gen 1 were worked out. This lock manages to be worse. It NEVER connects. It’s an expensive traditional lock that requires a key, only this one lights up for a few seconds giving you the false hope it is “smart”. It is not. I went through every last trouble shooting hoop kevo/kwikset guided me through, and none worked. Don’t ignore all the other bad reviews like I did. Buy another lock. Any other lock. Just not this.
customer_reviews.author: EricT

customer_reviews.title: Very limited integrations and small run on batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible integration. It doesn’t work with Nest even it is announced. Integration with Ring smart bell is done by special button that is just open another application. You should keep Kevo app always open to be able to unlock the the door. No integrations with any other assistants than Alexa. No integrations with Z-Wave or Zigbee. Integration with IFTTT doesn’t allow to (un)lock the door. Batteries live for 4-6 weeks only.
customer_reviews.author: NGart

customer_reviews.title: A little slow to open.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit slow to open but works. It does go through batteries pretty quickly. I would say I have to change 3 to 4 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: We installed the lock on our front door. We usually stay in our family room on the 2nd floor and have to go downstairs often to open the door for visitors. I have a camera system in which I can speak and see anyone at the front door and now I can unlock the door from upstairs to let known visitors in.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Couple of down falls but all in all a good lock.
customer_reviews.text: All in all this lock is pretty great. It’s easy to install on the door and easy to set up using the app. The first couple of days after setting it up my bridge kept losing service and I had to factory reboot it. In order to unlock the lock just by tapping it you must keep the app running in the background of your phone which is the only crappy thing because I like to force close all of my apps. But all in all I like this lock and plan on getting another for my back door.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Love that this can be used either via Bluetooth or with an actual key. Sadly the Bluetooth feature won't connect to any phone and the key usage works well and my house is secure.
customer_reviews.author: JohariK

customer_reviews.title: frequently have to close and reopen app
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with this lock. In the 2 weeks I've had it to close and restart the Kevo app 3 times in my iPhone to get it to work. Also, I have a habit of brushing the deadbolt with my forearm when opening or closing the door, causing it to lock or unlock. I know that's not an issue with the lock itself, but it is annoying and something to watch out for if you purchase this deadbolt.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it; it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: After using the kevo for about a month now, i just wished I payed more attention to the reviews here. This thing does not work how it should. The Bluetooth connection is sketchy and will probably work once every 15-20 tries or so. Which makes me default to just using a regular key. I gave access to the lock to one of my friends but she just couldn't get in at all, so no use in having this poorly made lock in my place. Don't buy it; it's not worth it even for half the price
customer_reviews.author: Leao

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product in May 2018 and so far it’s locked me out three times. Today was the last straw. You product is garbage, and I wish I could exchange this for the simple push button kwikset. You’ve cost me more than 400 dollars in lock smith charges. Don’t buy this product. Second, customer support is closed on Saturday after 2:30p and Sunday. CX should be a 24/7 service. Also sometimes the lock randomly locks and sometimes the app doesn’t even work.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Brown

customer_reviews.title: Kevo Plus unavailable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a kevo lock, and it works great, with just the kevo functionality. Unfortunately, it doesn't meet my needs because I can't get kevo plus, because kwikset doesn't have any, and won't for 4-6 weeks. (That's outside of the return window for this product.) I wouldn't order a kevo if you need kevo plus functionality until kwikset has them in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Alison R Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $
customer_reviews.text: This lock has been a nightmare. I have had it for 4 months and it has gotten progressively worse. I will be purchasing a different product than throwing this one in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R

customer_reviews.title: The Touch to unlock works maybe 20% of the time ...
customer_reviews.text: The Touch to unlock works maybe 20% of the time not what i expected.. I have to use the Key most of the time which is opposite of the reason of buying this
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Product
customer_reviews.text: My very first review on Amazon. I can lock it with the app. I cannot open it with the app and need to hunt for the key. If you must hunt for the key, then the product is garbage. Lastly, my contractor and I used TOOLS to get the slide open to change the batteries. Once it was opened, we couldn't get the batteries out. What a terrible product. Do not by this garbage. I will be packaging it up and sending it to the loser CEO. What kind of CEO can't make sure a lock works correctly. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bren

customer_reviews.title: Not for Alexa but works well and is most secure of all smart locks
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews on how easy these can be hacked. This one did the very best and I like it. It doesn't work well with Alexa at all
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Headache of a purchase
customer_reviews.text: I should've done my research first, this wont connect to my Samsung smart things hub. Also app glitches and would randomly unlock and then lock again, when I check the history to see who did it it said I did when I didn't. Batteries drained very quickly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Michael Schleef

customer_reviews.title: Love living key free!
customer_reviews.text: Love it , very convenient with kids. Easy install. You can share password & customize entry for visitors/family for one hour to days; Our only complaint is you need to change battery more often than expected. Also comes with a hard set key. Love the Bluetooth technology & living key free.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Verdecchio

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This lock has been more trouble than it's worth. The batteries didn't last a month. We've had to re-calibtate the lock multiple times. It takes at least 3 touches to work with my phone. The pairing gas been lost multiple times from my husband's phone. Today it didn't even recognize that I was touching the lock, and the lick wasn't visible in the app so I had to enter through our garage door. Of course the worst failure happened within a week of the return window closing. We're reverting to a dumb lock or getting a Schlag. Don't waste your on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not working
customer_reviews.text: First one was defective, I returned and got another one which is defective the same way. The lock mechanism sticks and does not lock.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Babaian

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the Kevin Deadbolt I was excited. It worked pretty well and I loved the Ekey feature. While I like the concept it works about 1 out of 4 touches. Its frustrating and not very reliable. We sent an eKey to a guest. It took them over 30 minutes for the lock to work. There are cheaper system out there I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CBShopping

customer_reviews.title: Great product, the worst customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Its a very neat product, very convenient when it works. Unfortunately I can only pair one phone, at the moment of the E-Key creation the app stops working, customer service is non-existent, I have been calling, sending reports sending e-mails and never got a response. I guess I could have sent it back but I know its a simple issue that could be fixed with some support...
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: and a briefcase in your arms your favorite thing is for your $250 automatic lock not to ...
customer_reviews.text: This item works only occasionally. About 25% of the time. The rest of the time it ends up just being infuriating because with an armload of groceries, a dog, and a briefcase in your arms your favorite thing is for your $250 automatic lock not to work. I've had this for a month now and I'm thinking about asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend. Mine doesn’t work at all ever and shuts ...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend. Mine doesn’t work at all ever and shuts down multiple times a day. The app says it’s shutting down.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Only works about half of the time
customer_reviews.text: When it is working, it works fairly well. It does not react as quickly as I would like, though. The worst part is that half of the time it simply does not work and opening the app to unlock the door takes multiple minutes. It is a novel concept, but not worth purchasing until they fix the connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L

customer_reviews.title: however it is slightly annoying that sometimes you have to touch the lock a ...
customer_reviews.text: First model I received didn't work and had to be returned to Kwikset. Once I received my replacement it works, however it is slightly annoying that sometimes you have to touch the lock a couple of times before it works. I assume that this is our to the time the app takes to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth lock
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift so it has not been installed yet, but he was very happy to receive it.
customer_reviews.author: Annetta Varner

customer_reviews.title: Find a better smart lock!
customer_reviews.text: A very easy deadbolt to install, however, programming and syncing it to your smart phone was almost near impossible. It took at least 50 attempts to download the software update, then even if you thought that would help, the lock would never sync to your smart phone, so the deadbolt never worked. It would light up with the blue ring on the outside, but never do anything more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: The one star is because it looks great. Otherwise I went through three motor assemblies and all of them failed, the first didn’t even work out of the box. The deadbolt motor assembly is so cheap it cannot last on daily use for more than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I read the bad reviews but tried it thinking it might work for me.  it didnt.
customer_reviews.text: never worked well. even at its best it usually took a couple tries to connect to the phone (so 30 secs of standing around). battery drained every few months despite me readjusting the strike plate several times, wasnt contacting the plate which is all customer service blamed it on. broke 1 year and 6 days after my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ralph montilone

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with my current gen phone!
customer_reviews.text: This lock installed pretty easily like most deadbolt locks. However the app is NOT compatible with my Moto Z Play which is running Android 6.0.1 (which is listed as compatible on the box). The app also won't work on my LG tablet either. So I basically overpaid for a smart lock that isn't smart. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky L.

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these and 2 had some kind of defect. I spoke with Kwikset and got replacements. No luck. The cable is fragile and the design looks like it is only a matter time before all of them start to fail. Working on a return now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Campone

customer_reviews.title: Kwikset Kevo (2nd Gen) good as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the most part. There are random, unexplained, incidences were the lock will close as the door is being shut. Had no problems with smart phones. There was a little confusion when programing the fob. A short call to Kwikset support straightened everything out. Smart key worked great. We had a number of keys out to siblings so it was mandatory to be able to use the old keys.
customer_reviews.author: CJFronczek

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised. The only issue I had with it was our front door was a little tough to open. The lock would close, find it a little difficult , and would jump into error mode. If I was pulling the door in as the lock worked, it didn’t lock. I had to uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: M Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet Sophisticated Smart Lock
customer_reviews.text: We added this smart lock to our front door. I installed it without a problem, the guides are good and self explanatory. Calibrating the Touch to Open was very simple. The app is intuitive and runs in the background. Just approach door and touch : voila! It opens. We sent ekeys to the kids. Love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mycroft

product_meta.title: Kwikset - Kevo 99250-202 Kevo 2nd Gen Bluetooth Touch-to-Open Smart Keyless Entry Electronic Deadbolt Door Lock Featuring SmartKey Security, Satin Nickel
product_meta.description:
Color Name:Satin Nickel| Style:Kevo (2nd Gen)

Open your world with the Kevo Touch to Open Smart Lock powered by your smartphone and Bluetooth. Fumbling with your keys is now a thing of the past. Kevo 2nd Gen provides the same trusted touch to open smart lock experience available in Kevo 1st Gen teamed with a refined user experience, sleeker design and added security features. Kevo 2nd Gen features the latest version of the Kwikset patented SmartKey security. This single cylinder Bluetooth enabled deadbolt can be locked or unlocked by touching the exterior side of the deadbolt, or with a key from the outside, as well as the turn piece from the inside. Kevo (2nd Gen) also comes with In-home Locking & Unlocking from your smart device within Bluetooth range of the lock. The Lifetime Polished Brass finish adds to the traditional look and feel of the product and makes a classic statement.

Kevo 2nd Gen now works with Alexa voice commands (requires Kevo Plus hub, sold separately). You can lock/unlock (PIN required) and check lock status. 

Kwikset is working diligently to add new Android device compatibility to Kevo. Each device is put through a rigorous security and user experience test to ensure that our users have the most secure and best possible experience with Kevo. 

Android Compatibility: Pixel, Pixel XL, Nexus 5X,6, 6P,9, HTC One M9 Samsung Galaxy S5, S5 Active, S6, S6 Active, S6 Edge, S7 Active, S7 Edge, Note 4, Note 4 Edge, Note 5 Android Wear Devices

Apple iOS Compatibility: IPhone 4s, 5, 5s, 6, 6 Plus, 6s, 6s Plus, SE, 7, 7 Plus iPad 3rd Gen, iPad 4th Gen, Air, Air 2, Pro (12.9 inch), Pro (9.7 inch), iPad Mini, Mini 2, Mini 3, Mini 4 Pod Touch 5th Gen, 5th Gen (16GB Mid 2013), 6th Gen Apple Watch notifications only. 

We're pleased to share that Touch to Open functionality is fully restored with Apple's iOS 10.0.2 update. Upon downloading the latest iOS update, you will be able to use your Kevo lock with the app running in the background. 

Kwikset is pleased to announce that e-keys will be completely free of charge starting February 1, 2017. 

You gave us your feedback and we listened! Thank you for helping us improve your Kevo experience. 

Kevo is not compatible with Apple HomeKit.
feature_bullets: Your smartphone is now your key touch to open convenience with the 2nd generation. If you wish to perform a system reset, press and hold the reset button on the back panel for 10 seconds until the lock beeps and the light ring flashes red
Kevo 2nd gen now works with Alexa voice commands (requires Kevo Plus hub, sold separately for $99 via Kevo App)
Remote lock access & monitoring requires Kevo Plus hub, sold separately for $99 via Kevo App

3rd Gen Kevo App provides faster and more reliable connection. Smaller and sleeker metal interior with improved install experience. Now get free ekeys; Send and manage eKey access via smartphone receive notifications and monitor lock history
Compatible with iPhone 4S or higher and select Android 5.0 or higher devices
Works with Fob (sold separately) or traditional key with new advanced SmartKey security
Works with select iOS and Android devices (wider compatibility with updated Google Play Kevo app which determines full and partial compatibility) please check compatibility (below) before purchase
Smart Home compatibility with Amazon Alexa, Ring Doorbell, Skybell, Nest Learning Thermostat, select Honeywell Thermostats, Android Wear and IFTTT

Note: 1. Make sure that you have the most up to date operating system on your phone. 2. Please check the cable connection between the interior and exterior deadbolt. 3. Please confirm that you have Bluetooth on and activated on your phone and that your phone is paired with your lock

specifications.Installation Method: Easily installs in minutes with just a screwdriver
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars939 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
